Hennepin St. **Letter: Putnam County School District 535 seeks community input via survey** Letter to the Editor of the Putnam County Record from Putnam County School District #535 Superintendent Dr. Clayton Theisinger. **Letter: Putnam County Rotary continues its good work in the community** Letter to the Editor of the Putnam County Record from Debbie Buffington of the Putnam County Rotary. **Letter from Putnam County Rotary: Thank you for my year as president** Well, my year as Putnam County Rotary President is coming to an end and what a year it has been. **Letter from Putnam County Rotary: An open letter to prom parents** All parents want their kids to enjoy prom and stay safe. Rotary’s with you, again sponsoring the post-prom Afterglow so that our students can extend the enjoyment and excitement of their Prom night safely. **Letter from Putnam County Rotary: Putnam County Afterglow** Last year was our first year back after Covid and while attendance was low, prom-goers and students who attended had fun and won a record number of raffles and prizes. **Letter from Putnam County Rotary: Join us for Rotary Ag Night March 30** I am proud to be a Rotary member and I am excited to say that after a three-year hiatus due to covid we are once again hosting Rotary Ag Night. At 6 p.m. on Thursday, March 30 at PCHS, we will be celebrating the rich agricultural heritage of the county. **Letter from Putnam County Rotary: Soup for Seniors on Sunday Feb. 26** I hope to see you between 2 and 4 p.m. on Sunday Feb. 26 for ‘Soup for Seniors’ as we say thank you to all you very special county residents. **Letter from the Putnam County Rotary: This time of year can be lonely** Why did I pick loneliness to bring up this month? I know, shut up Deb, we don’t need to be reminded that we are alone and not going out or getting visitors. Well, this is where Rotary comes in. **Letter from Putnam County Rotary: Happy Holidays** **Letter from Putnam County Rotary: Happy Holidays** Can you believe the holiday season is here and the year is almost over?
